description:
Using thermal cameras to measure fevers has proven to not be an effective screening method.  Border guards are going to be key in preventing the rampant expansion of infected (but not symptomatic) people in to safe zones.  As already demonstrated by a few cases, it is human nature to lie about having been in an infected area, let alone close to an infected individual.  
Relying on the creation of new technology or anything that required long development and manufacturing cycles simply won’t be fast enough. 
The idea is simple and can be implemented in the rapid time scales that are required to combat this outbreak.    Everyone has a cell phone, we are all attached to them, even in the regions we are speaking about.   Working with a few of the telcos of the world (ATT, etc.), the idea is for them to quickly create an app for border guards to check IF your cell phone was in any of the infected areas over a certain period.  This app would be simple, upon screening for entry into the country, they ask for your phone number.  You give them your cell number (or IMEI number), they quickly confirm that’s the phone and then check against a geo-fenced area to see if you were in there in the last 21 days.  No date is kept, no specific locations given to border guards, just a yes or no.  No privacy issues.
Especially for anyone asking to gain access to a country, most would be perfectly okay to submit your cell phones IMEI number to go through a simple check to see if the phone was in that region.  


In general this could immediately screen clear the majority of the cases, speeding up work at border checkpoints and allowing the guards to focus on the fringe cases and the places that matter.  This will be especially important as infected cases and zones increase and the pressure will be to have a measured response while still not stalling out global travel and trade.
summary: Containment is key – Improve the ability for border guards to validate if you've been in a designated 'infected area' by using apps created by the telcos to validate your proximity to an infected zone or region in the last 21 days.  A ‘yes’ would trigger further or questioning and a ‘no’ would allow you to pass.
title: App for border guards to quickly assess if you've been in an infected region or not using your cell phones IMEI #.
